author: @jkennethking
comment:
The common in-practice use of “end to end” testing is quite different today than manual testing in a staging environment. It more often than not includes automated testing rather than manual testing these days.

It can still be brittle and slow but you do get quite a bit more coverage if you can stomach the wait times.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @thisoldproperty
comment: I'm returning, approx 2 years later, to say I took the comments of this video to heart, and changed my testing mechanism from pure 'end-to-end' to individual 'behaviour test driven development' (followed by 'end-to-end' as required). I'm glad I did. The change means faster (near immediate) feedback on specific changes to any code section. End-to-end still occurs, but no longer as a means to implement new code, or when updating old code. The change didn't happen over night, and getting myself into the mindset took a month or two before the benefits truly kicked in. In short; Thank you for planting the seed and suggesting an improvement.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @vyli1
comment: Conclusion is to do both E2E tests and tests in isolation. Not to exclude E2E testing; Many teams already do both.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @Htarlov
comment: I know a place for which E2E testing works relatively well. It works relatively well as a temporary testing suite made for a legacy monster of a system before approaching to refactor that and make it more testable and add unit tests. It gets terrible when managers see that we have test coverage now, slap themself a high five, and stop not giving time and budget to refactorize that legacy codebase.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @GoodVolition
comment: What I usually mean when I say E2E is a Puppeteer, Cypress, Selenium, etc type test that does things like "When Button A is Clicked by a User with Conditions X then API M is called with the correct parameters and the results will reflect the conditions." And similar things like "When API M responds with a error B we give the user a popup that says sorry the service is down." Stuff like that. For distributed systems you really need tracing of some kind plus some amount of unit testing or formal verification on the individual components.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @kdietz65
comment: These are wonderful ideas but every organization I've ever worked for was way too dysfunctional to ever come close to a methodical testing.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @KA-wf6rg
comment:
1000% -- It's refreshing to see someone discuss the things that have been on my mind for quite a while, and it's very difficult to get some people in organizations to let go of the false sense of security that large complex e2e or integration tests provide.  They call it "quality", while it's anything but quality.  What's more frustrating is that resistance is often combined with arrogance and unwillingness to learn.

Actually I'd venture to say it's the opposite of quality, because you are putting confidence in a methodology that has simply proven to be inadequate for testing large complicated systems -- especially today where each component may have connections and talk to multiple others, and so on.

Also, your videos have the best animations!

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @vectorhacker-r2
comment: I like your scientific reasoning approach to testing. That being that tests are experiments that test, pun intended, our assumptions about the code.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @DataNdGames
comment:
For software engineering this might be the correct approach. 
In data engineering and big data I feel we must do end to end testing because I have to test all of the system under stress

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @timmartin325
comment: I like a lot of the ideas in this channel. However, I think maybe a lot of them can only be achieved in rare perfect conditions where you have for example  a.) Complete control of development related activities in an organisation b.) A team of top notch developers who all generally get on well with each other c.) People focused more on what's best for the team rather than their own career. In the real world though things are a big mess and you might have better luck herding cats.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @williamsummy9395
comment: I recently started implementing Cypress into my teams app out of my own volition, and luckily this is an endeavor the company would like to move forward with. Doing it really showed me the value in system tests where we can go over every single circumstance, whereas our e2e tests only view the very limited happy path. E2E really started looking completely useless to me outside of accessibility testing and the most basic of pipeline checks for PRs.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @SkyCastleChronicles
comment: Thanks for this very nice video! I like the calm atmosphere!

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @AlexandreBarret
comment:
We replace the word « system » by «  object » and it becomes the definition of a unit test. Unit tests, integration tests, acceptance tests and e2e tests all look the same. A controlled input to assess expected output. The only differences I see are the relative scale and the tools used to control inputs and assess outputs. What am I missing?

We can easily imagine acceptance tests of a library/package barely being an integration test of another more complex system. The same way we could imagine unit testing a group of external systems from a system substantially bigger. Like if someone decided to test the internet. Maybe there is a system where we unit test the internet

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @purdysanchez
comment:
I've generally found that mocking system interactions for testing doubles the workload placed on developers.  In a perfect world everyone shares their test cases, but even then it's much cheaper to have people write proper documentation and public interfaces - if they can't do the latter, they definitely can't do the former.

Imagine if all consumers wrote tests to submit to all software libraries that they used to inform the publisher about how they were using the library.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @CareerWithNatalia
comment: Great video, thank you! From my experience, all projects still are using E2E testing under smoke or regressive suites.

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @andycoooke
comment: That was very useful - thanks!

video_title: E2E 테스트를 하지 마세요!
author: @georgeFulgeanu
comment:
I have to say, after listening to this and creating unit tests & integration tests for each system and E2E test to test systems working as expected. I realise that my e2e tests actually test high coupling between the systems. 
Always good to listen to these videos, even if I don't agree with some of the points :)

video_title: Let AI Explore Your Site & Write Tests with Playwright MCP!
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
What if your tests could write themselves by actually using your app like a real user?
In this video, we demo the Playwright MCP (Model Context Protocol) in action, using Agent Mode to explore a website, detect features, and generate meaningful end-to-end tests automatically.

🧪 What you'll see:

Running the MCP server locally in VS Code
Generating real tests through autonomous exploration
Discovering edge cases (yes, even bugs!)
Writing & running tests with zero manual scripting
Reviewing results in the Trace Viewer

Perfect for devs who want to accelerate test coverage, catch unexpected behavior, and leverage AI-powered testing with Playwright.

👉 Try it yourself and see what your app has been hiding from you!
Check out the blog post for detailed explanation and prompt file: https://dev.to/debs_obrien/letting-pl...

#Playwright #MCP #ModelContextProtocol #AITesting #TestAutomation #EndToEndTesting #DeveloperTools

video_title: AI-Driven Test Automation with Playwright + Cursor + MCP Server
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
In this tutorial, we show QA engineers and developers how to build a complete Playwright test automation framework in Python using AI. We integrate the Playwright Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server with Cursor IDE to generate a full framework (using the Page Object Model design pattern for maintainable, scalable test code) entirely through an AI prompt – no manual coding required. You’ll see how to go from initial setup to running real browser tests in one seamless flow, using AI to speed up development.

Repositories:

MCP Server: https://github.com/executeautomation/...
Where you can find my instructions, and my prompt: https://github.com/JoanEsquivel/playw...

video_title: Generating Playwright Tests With AI: Let's Try the New Playwright MCP Server!
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
In this video, Stefan (Playwright Ambassador) dives into the integration of AI with the Playwright MCP server to automate end-to-end test generation.

Learn about MCP, browser automation and how to combine everything to generate Playwright tests. We'll explore AI capabilities and limits and discuss best practices for generating accurate and reliable Playwright tests.

If you're curious about leveraging AI for end-to-end testing with Playwright, this video is for you!

00:00 Intro
00:26 Using Playwright MCP Server with Claude Desktop
02:00 Playwright MCP tool calls explained
03:44 End-to-end test generation with GitHub Copilot and Playwright MCP
08:51 Conclusion and outro

#syntheticmonitoring #playwright #checkly 

Resources:
Playwright MCP Server: https://github.com/microsoft/playwrig...
Checkly Playwright Check Suites: https://www.checklyhq.com/docs/playwr...
Find the used `copilot-instructions.md` below. 👇

```
\## Instructions

You are a Playwright test generator and an expert in TypeScript, Frontend development, and Playwright end-to-end testing.
You are given a scenario and you need to generate a Playwright test for it.
If you're asked to generate or create a Playwright test, use the tools provided by the Playwright MCP server to navigate the site and generate tests based on the current state and site snapshots.
Do not generate tests based on assumptions. Use the Playwright MCP server to navigate and interact with sites.
Access page snapshot before interacting with the page.
Only after all steps are completed, emit a Playwright TypeScript test that uses @playwright/test based on message history.
When you generate the test code in the 'tests' directory, ALWAYS follow Playwright best practices.
When the test is generated, always test and verify the generated code using `npx playwright test` and fix it if there are any issues.
```

video_title: Generating Playwright Tests With AI: Let's Try the New Playwright MCP Server!
author: @random-username-he
comment:
It will be interesting to see how companies adopt technology like this. The ultimate goal of testing will always be to accurately and clearly assert that functionality works as intended. This isn't something we can ever guarantee with AI, and there's always the possibility that a test itself is defective or erroneous. This could be a fantastic tool for disciplined teams that want to quickly generate tests but have the knowledge and patience to review everything it outputs - this could also be a very dangerous slope for juniours who don't know how their code should actually work, or companies looking to cut down on QAs to save some money. Interesting times ahead.

Thanks, Stefan, for this really helpful tutorial!

최근 들어 chatgpt 도 써보고 cursor 도 써보고 하는 중인데 node.js 1도 모르는 상태에서 react 랑 fastapi, postgre 로 작동하는 서비스 프로토타입 만드는데 4시간 정도면 가능함. 디자인 진짜 안 이쁘지만 일단 필수 기능 작동하게 가능함. 근데 얘가 한 60% 정도 되면 그때부터 헛소리를 시작함. a 가 문제라서 오류가 나는데 자꾸 b, c 가 문제라면서 엉뚱한거 고침. 그렇게 30분 정도 삽질하다가 야 지금 a가 문제인거 아니야? 하면 아! 좋은 지적입니다. 이러면서 그제서야 제대로 고치기 시작함... 결론은 문제가 생기면 어디가 문제일까 정도는 예측할 수 있어야 원하는 방향으로 만들 수 있는거 같음. 그리고 일단 완성하고 나면 이게 어떻게 돌아가는지 뜯어볼 엄두가 안 남... 리팩토링은 엄두도 안 남... ;ㅁ;

참고로 애가 좀 많이 해멘다 싶을 때는 "처음부터 찬찬히 다시 한번 생각해보자." 하면 전체 구조부터 시작해서 다시 점검하면서 문제점 찾긴 함. 그래도 좀만 복잡해지면 여전히 어리버리.....

video_title: AI가 코딩을 종말시킨다...? AI 산업 최전선에서 본 믿을 수 없는 AI 기반 코딩 현 상황 (임백준대표x안될공학 1부)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, LLaMA는 물론 Devin, GitHub Copilot, Cursor AI까지, 프로그래밍을 해보지 않은 사람들도 수려한 퀄리티의 프로그램을 뚝딱 만들어내는 게 현재의 상황. 이러한 자동화 툴로 인해 코딩의 벽이 낮아졌음은 물론, 기존 개발자와 프로그래머들의 생산성도 어마무시하게 증대했는데요. AI가 실제로 우리 인간의 삶을 혁신적으로 변화시키고 있다는 대표적인 예시 중에 하나입니다. 이처럼 급격한 변화 속에서 우리는 AI가 무엇인지, 그리고 앞으로 우리에게 어떤 영향을 미칠지에 대해 깊이 생각해볼 필요가 있는데요. AI 산업의 최전선에서 20년 이상 활동해 오시면서 세계적인 기업에서 다양한 직책을 거치며 실무 경험을 쌓아, 현재는 AI 전문가로서 많은 사람들에게 AI에 대한 깊이 있는 통찰을 전달하신, 신간 『AI트루스』의 저자 임백준 대표님을 모시고 인사이트를 얻어보는 시간을 준비하였습니다!

본 영상은 이번 임백준 대표님의 강연 중 첫 영상으로, 코딩을 중심으로 AI의 변화와 우리 삶의 변화, 산업의 변화에 대해 파악해봅니다.

『AI 트루스』  소개
.임백준 저자님의 대표작 『AI 트루스』는 AI에 대한 철학적, 기술적 접근을 넘나들며, AI의 미래를 예측하는 가장 객관적인 안내서로 평가받고 있습니다. 본 책에서는 2034년 미래에 대한 예측부터 시작해, AI가 인간의 욕망과 어떻게 맞물리는지, 그리고 AI 기술이 우리 사회에 어떤 영향을 미칠지를 깊이 있게 다루는데요. 또한, AI의 역사를 1970년대부터 현재까지 생생하게 포착해, 기술이 발전해온 흐름과 그 이면에 숨겨진 철학적 질문들에 대해서도 탐구합니다. 특히, 다양한 산업 분야에서 AI가 미칠 영향과 이를 준비하는 방법에 대한 저자의 깊은 통찰이 담겨 있어 일독을 권합니다.
#인공지능 #AI #코딩

Written by Error
Edited by 이진이

author: @Dojjikba
comment:
과거엔 ‘영상 콘텐츠’ 하면 전문적인 기술과 장비, 그리고 전파나 극장과 같은 인프라가 갖춘 전문가들만이 다루던 영역이었죠. 하지만 유튜브가 등장하고 스마트폰 카메라로 누구나 영상을 찍을 수 있는 시대가 오면서, 영상 전문가들 눈엔 시답지 않은 일반인들의 컨텐츠가 각광받는 시대가 되었습니다. 
코딩 또한 마찬가지 입니다. Ai가 더욱 발전하면 누구나 코딩을 접할 수 있게 되며 어플리케이션 풍요의 시대가 열리겠죠. 창의력과 치밀한 전략을 갖춘 1인 기업의 전성시대가 오고있네요ㅎㅎ

author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Vercel's v0 uses AI to create beautiful UIs but the magic really happens because of shadcn components! I'll show you how you can create UIs just like v0 in Cursor without needing the extra subscription - and with all the flexibility of editing and managing your code in a full-fledged code editor.

🛠️ Resources:
GitHub: https://github.com/VoloBuilds/vite-re...
Shadcn vite installation instructions: https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/installati... 
🚀 In This Video, You'll learn:
What is shadcn
What are shadcn components
What is a design system
How to build beautiful UIs with Cursor
Best AI front end library
Best AI coding assistant
Cursor vs v0

Web Development 2025

author: @nxtintimeLive
comment: I think v0 shines more at creating good looking UIs and being very close to the requirements given by the prompt. I use it all the time just for prototyping UIs and for getting good starter ideas, i rarely even use the code it provides. Cursor on the other hand helps code wise, not a little but a lot. Specially when i‘m working for too long in one session and my head starts itching, cursor jumps in and lets me work way efficient by rather validating solutions and modifying them instead of coming up with new ones. I think the combo of both is actually crazy and i rarely use gpt anymore. Being a webdev in 2025 is so amazing

video_title: Copilot Prompt Engineering: UI 프레임워크 3개, AI 에이전트 2개, 코딩 어시스턴트 1개(AIDER CCC)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Code like you're in the future. This is the best way to progress your engineering abilities at a rapid pace. In groundbreaking video, we delve into pair programming assistant AIDER, an AI-driven coding assistant that, with a new technique, can transform the way we approach software development. I've been using this technique and AIDER to write code and ship features faster than ever before. Thanks to the latest GPT-4 Turbo model, AIDER is reshaping our programming capabilities. Our focus? Building vital front-end components for a Postgres data analytics tool. But here's the catch – we're not just coding; we're prompting code into existence using a technique I've honed called TRIPLE C (CCC). This intuitive, in editor, in terminal approach leverages the power of LLMs and prompt engineering, allowing us to generate complex code through natural language.

We'll see firsthand how AI co-pilots, powered by the latest GPT-4 model, have become incredibly efficient and accurate. To showcase this, we're building the UI in three different frameworks – one of which I've never used before. This isn't just about coding; it's about AI Engineering our way to a minimal viable product for a data analytics frontend. Through 'Comment Copilot Coding', you write the comments, and AIDER fills in the code. It's a perfect blend of simple in editor, in context natual language prompting and AI efficiency. This video isn't just a tutorial; it's a glimpse into the future of software development, where natural language becomes the ultimate programming language. We'll open multiple terminals, run AIDER simultaneously, and utilize our multi-agent Postgres data analytics tool behind a simple python flask API to generate SQL and SQL results directly from our new UIs. Dive into the realm of multi-agent coding, demonstrating that with tools like AIDER and the expansive capabilities of GPT-4 Turbo, the real question shifts from: "what can I build?" to "How quickly can I build". Let's push the boundaries of AI in software engineering as we take one more step toward agentic engineering.

Aider Prompt: "Read the comments and wherever you see 'code:' generate the request. Keep all code generation in the component."

video_title: 저는 아내에게 67분 만에 커서를 사용하여 코딩하는 방법을 가르쳤습니다.
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
I showed my wife how to use Cursor and Claude Sonnet 3.5 to build a real AI-powered application without knowing how to code! It turned out to be a very realistic view of what it's like for someone who doesn't know how to code to use tools like Cursor (hint: it's still very hard!)

The reality is that there are many concepts like environmental variables, packages, APIs, shortcuts, and more - that new developers are not familiar with. We discuss all of these concepts and answer some questions that should help true beginners!

📚 Resources:
Free AI Coding Prompt Guide: https://github.com/VoloBuilds/prompts... 
🚀 In This Video, You'll learn:
How to use Cursor AI as a beginner
How to get started with AI coding
How to build apps without knowing how to code
Coding with Cursor and Sonnet 3.5
The best way to code with AI in 2024
How to code with Cursor AI
How to use AI to write code for you
How to troubleshoot code with AI
Prompts to use in Cursor
Coding in 2024
Web Development 2024
💡 Perfect for Viewers Interested in:
Coding with AI
Full Stack software development
Software Development
Future of coding
Learning to code in 2024
Best AI coding tools
Using AI to code
Web Development
Learning about the latest AI tech
Generative AI
Subscribe for more tutorials on AI and programming and to stay up to date on the latest AI updates and news!!

💬 Questions or Feedback? Drop your thoughts in the comments below, and I'll be sure to get back to you!

video_title: Aider + NextJS + O1 & O1-Mini: 단 하나의 프롬프트로 풀스택 앱 생성(Claude보다 나을까요?)
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Join this channel to get access to perks:
   / @aicodeking  

In this Video, I'll be telling you that how you can setup Aider with the New OpenAI O1 & O1 Mini Model and Generate some great Full-Stack NextJS Application with it. I'll be creating a full-stack App using AI without writing any code. This going to be a full-hands on about how you can create full-stack applications with AI. 

Aider & O1 / O1 Mini is a new combination AI based coding agent that beats Cursor AI and is free and opensource. It allows you to generate applications with AI and it is fully opensource. This is a fully opensource and free Cursor AI alternative. You can also use it as a VS Code Alternative with AI features. This AI Code Editor comes with free OpenAI O1 & O1 Mini usage. It is an AI Coding Agent or Text-To-Application tool that is super easy to use. It can generate code with Claude-3.5-Sonnet, Gemini, OpenAI, Ollama and Any other Model and it can also generate whole NextJS, Python and other applications within seconds. It's very similar to Cursor but it's better than that. I'll be generating some simple applications but you can also use it to generate Games, Applications, Web Applications, Websites, Frontend, Backend and multiple other things. You can also do Text-To-Frontend, Text-To-Application, Text-To-Game and other things with this. Zed AI can also be used with any opensource LLM, OpenAI models or the other Claude models such as GPT-4O, Claude-3, CodeQwen, Mixtral 8x22b, Mixtral 8x7b, GPT-4, Grok-1.5 & Gemini Code Assist. 

----
Key Takeaways:

✨ OpenAI's O1 Model takes coding to the next level, excelling in coding, math, chemistry, and more! 🚀 Discover the future of AI with advanced tools.

🏆 O1 dominates Aider's benchmarks with a whopping 79.7% success rate in code editing tasks! 💻 This state-of-the-art model is changing the coding game.

💡 Optimize code edits effortlessly with Aider’s "diff" format—saving time and reducing costs! ⏳ Efficient AI for faster, smarter coding solutions.

💰 Sonnet outshines O1 in cost-efficiency, offering insane value for coding with built-in prompt caching! 💸 Discover the AI tool that saves you money.

🚧 Rate limits hold O1 back—only available to OpenAI Tier 5 enterprise users with heavy restrictions. ⚠️ Accessing the full power of O1 is still a challenge.

📱 Create amazing apps like a pro using NextJS with Aider’s O1 and O1-mini models! 📚 Watch as AI builds your app effortlessly, from book managers to calorie trackers.

🔥 Sonnet still reigns supreme for coders, outperforming O1 in both cost and functionality! 💡 Choose the AI model that gives you the best value for your code edits.

-----

video_title: Aider + NextJS + O1 & O1-Mini: 단 하나의 프롬프트로 풀스택 앱 생성(Claude보다 나을까요?)
author: @SergeyVazon
comment:
Yes, Claude seems to have a better source algorithm for programming than chatGPT. I compared several times on the same queries and Claude always wrote more accurate and often shorter code. When asked to optimize my method chatGpt only optimized a bit, Claude saw the internal patterns and almost halved the method (about as much as I thought possible for the query).
I think that OpenAi in the new models changed some general principles of approach to query processing and postprocessing, while the basic programming remained at the same level, while Claude's basic principle is much better and more precise. Thanks for the review!

video_title: 3대 IT 거물과 함께하는 Sandeep Jain | Tech Baat Cheet | 초보자와 전문가를 위한 팁
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Hello everyone! 

Today, we have 3 special guests on our podcast, Kavita Aroor (Head of Developer and Startup Marketing - South Asia at Nvidia), RadhaKrishna (Co-founder and CEO of JyoRa) and Janardhan (Director of Engineering at Dell). 

They all have been working in the industry for the past 16-20 years. 
 
In this video, we'll be majorly covering the journeys of these tech leaders, while discussing some tips and tricks that helped them build a strong IT career. 

It covers in detail different coding concepts, such as, what it is like to go for a computer science role vs a data science role, how AI affects the coding industry, how to make better coding projects, what is developer marketing, whether you should go for it and much more. 

Kavita also discussed her experience working with foreign and Indian software developers and which was more difficult for her to handle.

The podcast is filled with industry insights and tips from the experts that can help you make right decisions and give you enough clarity about the future of coding in India. 

So watch the podcast till the end and Subscribe for more amazing content.

RadhaKrishna Bollineni - IBM (Ex - Director - AI & GenAi)
  / radhakrishna-bollineni  

Kavita Aroor - Intel (Ex - Head of Developer Marketing APJ)
  / kavitaaroor  

Janardhan Revuru - Director of Engineering - Dell
  / rjanardan  

Chapters 
00:00 - Introduction
00:46 - Kavita’s introduction
01:12 - Radhakrishna’s introduction
02:14 - Janardhan introduction
02:52 Kavita - What is developer marketing?
06:52 Kavita - Difference between developer relationships and developer marketing
07:55 Kavita - Beginning for a developer relationship role
09:47 Janardhan - Joining and building communities
13:09 - Radhakrishna's career
14:51 Radhakrishna - Qualities while hiring for data science roles
16:38 Radhakrishna - Standard interview questions 
18:51 Radhakrishna - Common job roles in the industry
21:09 Radhakrishna - Machine Learning as a job

video_title: ONE BILLION Row Challenge: Electron, DuckDB, Aider, Cursor를 활용한 AI 코딩
author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
Have you heard of the One BILLION Row Challenge? It's a  viral coding trend where engineers calculate min, mean, and max in the least amount of time possible from a text file of 1 BILLION ROWS. 

I figured this would be a great opportunity to show off the future of AI-powered coding demonstrating how you can supercharge your software engineering skills using Copilots like Aider, and Cursor and tech like Electron and DuckDB. In our AI Devlog walkthrough, we break down how to tackle the min, mean, and max calculation challenge on a massive dataset using DuckDB. We'll use the latest version of turbo4, an OpenAI assistants API wrapper that enables you to build knowledge bases directly from URLs. Your custom turbo4 assistant can then consume the knowledge base and generate code for you.

This channel is dedicated to helping you transform from a traditional coder to an Agentic engineer, adept in leveraging the potency of AI-enhanced coding techniques and next-gen tools like the Assistants API from OpenAI to elevate your productivity and capability in the modern coding landscape.

We start by setting up an Electron app and guide you through using Typescript, the Vuetify framework for Vue UI components, and DuckDB's in-memory database for handling ONE BILLION rows of data efficiently. Our focus is on clear, applied knowledge, we don't care about typescript types we care about learning how to build like we're an engineer of the future. We'll utilize Two AI Coding assistants: Aider and Cursor. We'll talk and show what they're both good at and where they're weak. By following our methodical approach, you'll learn valuable strategies for improving prompt engineering abilities and get ahead of the AI wave that's redefining software engineering. Subscribe to our channel for more professional insights into AI coding, and check out our description for links to Aider, Cursor, and the Assistants API documentation.

Massive shout out to all the engineers who have participated in the One BILLION Row Challenge and all the engineers that's code has been used as a knowledge base to build large language models.

💻 One Billion Row Challenge - Electron Edition

https://github.com/disler/1brc-electron

author: Uploader(Desc)
comment:
본 논문은 Facebook Research 팀이 2020년 8월에 ECCV에서 발표한 이미지 내 객체 탐지(Object Detection) 방법에 관한 논문으로, 기존의 객체 탐지 기술과 비교했을 때 매우 간단한 아키텍처를 가지면서 높은 성능을 내는 방법을 제안하였습니다. 발표된 지 얼마 안 되었으나 많은 이목을 끌고 있어 리뷰해 보았습니다.

본 시리즈의 동영상에서 사용된 강의 자료(PPT)와 코드는 다음의 깃허브 저장소에 업로드됩니다.
